messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-Discussion] Biology
messages.msgSnippet: HYPERLINK http://highschoolhub.org/hub/biology.cfm http://highschoolhub.org/hub/biolo gy.cfm Might help. Also you might check with a local college and see if
messages.messageBody:
HYPERLINK
"http://highschoolhub.org/hub/biology.cfm"http://highschoolhub.org/hub/biolo
gy.cfm
Might help. Also you might check with a local college and see if they offer
a biology course that she could audit..
Dawn

-----Original Message-----
From: CelticFrau@... [mailto:CelticFrau@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 28, 2003 5:48 AM
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Biology


As I've mentioned before, my oldest (12th grade, coming out of public
school)
wants to "do" biology in addition to Algebra II.� She's picked out an
algebra
book, but I have no clue if there is any biology program out there that
would
be interesting, not just a textbook.� We're going to frequent the library,
but can she learn biology from regular books?� Experiments?� Is there a
"curriculum" out there that anyone would suggest over another?� I know, I
know...this
list is for unschooling, but it's what SHE wants.� She wants to try and get
into college the middle of the year and has her head set on
nursing/anesthesiology.� Thanks.

Nancy B. in WV

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Biology
messages.msgSnippet: As I ve mentioned before, my oldest (12th grade, coming out of public school) wants to do biology in addition to Algebra II.  She s picked out an algebra
messages.messageBody:
As I've mentioned before, my oldest (12th grade, coming out of public school)
wants to "do" biology in addition to Algebra II. She's picked out an algebra
book, but I have no clue if there is any biology program out there that would
be interesting, not just a textbook. We're going to frequent the library,
but can she learn biology from regular books? Experiments? Is there a
"curriculum" out there that anyone would suggest over another? I know, I know...this
list is for unschooling, but it's what SHE wants. She wants to try and get
into college the middle of the year and has her head set on
nursing/anesthesiology. Thanks.

Nancy B. in WV


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
